Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: kaz1812
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed here for 3 nights in March. The hotel is basic and does seem in need of some updating but good value for money given it is in Paris. On first impressions the outside seems quite tatty with dead plants in all the window boxes which could have been removed. The room itself was very poorly lit and this could be improved, one of the lights didn't work at all. On a good note the bed was comfy and the room generally seemed fairly clean. The staff were also friendly and willing to help with directions or advice. If you are looking for a basic hotel at a reasonable price this hotel could be for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean!”
Reviews.Author: MadaminGrisverd
Reviews.Content: We spent two days at the Hotel Du Nord during March 2012. It is clean, with nice rooms and you can find a parisienne atmosphere. The location of the hotel is strategic: very near to the Metro, Place de la Republique and the romantic Canal St. Martin (which is a good place for having dinner with a lot of nice brasseries). The owners are really friendly and you can have your key for come-and-go everytime you like. The price is not expensive, compared to the place where it is located. The bed is really comfortable. Higly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: spetharoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my partner in November and it was just what we wanted. Rooms were fairly small but adequate and decorated lovely. Hotel had a really nice feel and the staff were very helpful and welcoming. Located near some great bars and restaurants, plus two small supermarkets and really close to two metro lines making it really easy to get everywhere. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Value”
Reviews.Author: teamht
Reviews.Content: I think that "Average" is too low a score I also think "very" good is a little too much...Good would be ideal. We stayed at Hotel du Nord le Paris Velo December 5th to 7th 2011. It's a 10 minute/1 kilometre walk from Gare du Nord and only 100 metres from the Metro station Jacques Bonsergent and only a little further to Republique in the opposite direction. The street itself is non descript, the hotel being the prettiest looking building draped in greenery. Inside is a hodge podge of nick nacks, trivia and guide books - not all for Paris and not all in French. It has a homely feel to it with warmth, despite the time of year and the solid stone floor in reception. Our room was on the first floor, we took the elevator with bags on arrival but the spiral staircase is manageable. Our room was directly above the reception it was not a problem; the only hotel noise we got was coming through the wall where the elevator shaft was the other side. The room was warm, so warm in fact we turned the heating down a notch and opened a window whilst we were indoors. The bed was two singles put together with a surprisingly snug fit. And comfortable. The en suite was a three piece with a shower not bath. Apart from a slight let down in the wardrobe/drawers department and no kettle/tea coffee facilities, we had all we wanted...there is a flat screen tele. Breakfast is in the basement. Arched stone walls and ceilings fitted with a mish mash of furniture. Breakfast was traditionally French, 4 pieces of bread, tea or coffee and some home made jams/marmalades. A bit dissapointing for the true Brit in me but it did see you through the morning. Hotel du Nord is a nice place, it is spotlessly clean everywhere and the staff speak very good English. It's definitely value for money and if your going to be spending most of your visit out and about this place is great. Would I stay there again...lottery wins aside, yes!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, cosy, clean, friendly, and a great shower.”
Reviews.Author: majworld
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I stayed at this very reasonable hotel for a long weekend in November. The room was small, but perfectly adequate, comfortable and clean and warm. The street was quiet, and the double-glazing kept out any city noise. We were given a good map too. Very happy, and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, a good place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: sara123
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay. The staff were very welcoming but also non intrusive. Mehdi met us on the first day and was great. The whole place was very clean and I think that is one of the most important things in any place I stay- I hope the cleaning ladies are rewarded accordingly, we saw them every morning and seemed really nice and hardworking. The bedroom was fine, really clean, enough space, the bathroom was also clean so for that it gets 5/5. A 2 minute walk from Jacques Bonsergeant metro and only 3 mins from Republique. You can walk in to town but distances are further than they seem generally so if you are spending a few days in Paris buy a carnet of 10 metro tickets to get around because public transport is so good. We had breakfast out of the hotel (there is a place on the main road, somewhere behind the hotel on boulevard de magenta, i cant remember its name, its blue in colour, serves a hot drink, orange juice, croissant or pain au chocolat for about 5 euro) but I think it is well worth having the hotel breakfast for 7.50 euro, as a simple breakfast can still be quite pricey in the local cafes.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: minghui79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Du Nord for 3 nights during our recent visit to the city of Paris. The hotel was located within 3 minutes walk from Jacques Bonsergent Metro Station along a quiet road. The small cutesy boutique hotel was elegant and had a retro, country feeling. We had a triple room at level 4 and it was very brightly decorated with green beddings. The clean room wasn't big but it was cosy for the 3 of us. The well-maintained bathroom was small but it was certainly functionable. Breakfast wasn't included in the room rate but for 7.50 Euros per person, we had a selection of 3 breads, home made apple jam, orange juice and nice coffee. We ended up having our daily breakfast at our own cosy spot at the basement. I liked that the service staffs in this hotel were all very friendly and helpful to our needs. They spoke good English. Prior to this trip, I had misgivings about the French being arrogant. Hotel Du Nord certainly helped changed that misconception. In fact, everywhere we go in Paris, we encountered very nice Parisan hospitality. For expensive Paris, Hotel Du Nord provided good value for money in a decent neighbourhood that wasn't too far from the sights. We certainly enjoyed our stay and playing with the friendly dog by the door. However, the room and bathroom might be on the small side, this might not be recommended for all travellers. We did not have any problems with the size though.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice in Paris”
Reviews.Author: lunabetty
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just what we needed - the standard/small room was perfectly adequate with a functional and functioning bathroom plus all the necessaries. Staff were friendly and helpful. The best bit though is the location - very handy to useful metro stations; and walking distance to the Marais, Canal St Martin etc - so we went on some lovely walks. There is also an amazing & famous bakery around the corner - Du Pain et des Idées – 34 Rue Yves Toudic which was our breakfast every day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: PandC_11
Reviews.Content: When in Paris, you're not likely to be spending a lot of time in your room, so we look for a basic, clean room in a good location. Oh, and it has to be inexpensive. Not many places fit this criteria, but this one does. The rooms are good sized, the bed (in our double) was comfortable/large and the bathroom right sized. There is street noise, so it's always nice to have earplugs handy. It is VERY basic - no frills here, but what more could you want for 82E? We found the breakfast, at 7.50E each was an excellent deal (remember, this is Paris), so we had it all 5 mornings. There are places around that serve coffee and a croissant, but they charged the same price (for less food). For breakfast here you'll get coffee/croissant/juice/2 kinds of baguette breads/jellies. It's not what many of us are used to for breakfast, but it really is quite good. As others have said, it's near several metro stops. Once you've figured out the metro map, getting around Paris is easy using the metro. You can walk to the sites from here (Louvre 30min, Orsay 45min, Notre Dame 25min), but it's really not through the best parts of town, so we found the metro (despite being crowded at times) a better way to get around. BTW, it took us 1 hour to get from here to the CDG airport via metro/RER. Good restaurants are limited in this area - we found better offerings on the other side of the canal (about a 10 minute walk). This is not really the tourist part of town, so fixed priced menu offerings are not easy to find - you'll likely have to order ala carte. The staff is helpful in providing restaurant recommendations. Would I recommend to my friends? Yes. But I would have them keep their expectations low (so they'll be pleased).

Reviews.Title: “We Loved it and loved the staff”
Reviews.Author: F77Cairo
Reviews.Content: staff very helpfull and nice, very cosy , in a nice area , very very close to a metro station , clean

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Boise123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to the Gare du Nord train station (15 minute walk) and close to the Republique Metro stop (2 minute walk). A walk to the Louvre took about 25-30 minutes. It is in a non-touristy neighborhood and has great access to grocery stores (there is one just down the block), cafes, and restaurants. Our room was spare, but very clean. The room looked out onto a window well and directly onto another building. If you have a hard time sleeping with noise going on, bring earplugs. The neighbors voices echoed throughout the window well. I'm not sure I would have slept well without earplugs. This hotel was in a great location, was clean, comfortable, safe, and a great value for the price. I would definitely recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: PoppaMack
Reviews.Content: I loved the ambience of this tiny hotel. On a side street, but close to Place dela Republique, and only two blocks from the Metro station. There are lots of restaurants and coffee shops nearby, and we walked to Sacre Coeur (highly recommend the tower climb) in 20 minutes or so. We stayed in a 'renovated' room, which may have made a big difference. It had new laminate flooring and lighting and a nice bathroom with a tub/shower. The whole thing looked to be easily cleaned and was tidy. Our room opened up onto a window well between buildings on the back which provided ventilation without noise. The windows on the street would be more interesting, but louder. The room was really small, but I presume that's normal for Paris. I didn't go there to watch TV. The manager was very helpful and pleasant, and we had no trouble with the booking. We left our bags early in the day and checked in later with no problem. Our visit in May had great weather and needed neither heat nor cooling. I have only one real comment on this hotel - don't be there in a fire. As far as I could tell, all of the rooms opened directly onto the open stairway up the middle of the hotel. It has wooden treads and would make an excellent chimney. I could see no other way to get out - no exit stairs - except the windows. On the back, that nice window well would fill with smoke in no time and I think any occupants would be stuck. And the front door needed a key to open it from inside or outside, so not great for a panic exit. Perhaps this is common in Paris, but I was crossing my fingers.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little hotel near to the city & metro”
Reviews.Author: SarnyCay
Reviews.Content: Easy to reach from CDG - even after a 20 hour travel time. Hotel room was small (which was expected due to the old inner city building) and very clean. Personal touch due to colour in the room, books and very friendly & helpful staff. Booking only through email, after some miscommunication with one staff member, Daniel was quick & helpful confirming our stay. Unique reception area, small staircase (or even smaller elevator) leading to the upstairs rooms. You get a key to the front door as they front desk closes at 11:30pm. We enjoyed the stay a lot, room was very quiet (but didnt have a view other than the court yard) but who wants to stay indoors when in Paris anyway :). We didnt get to try the breakfast due to our jet lag, but found a little bakery just around the corner with fresh baguette sandwiches. All in all, would come back and stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint little hotel with very good access to the city & metro”
Reviews.Author: sunnymundo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in spring/summer 2010 and it was really easy to get to - even after traveling over 20 hours, landing at CDG. With the train & Subway it was easy to reach, two subway stations very close by. Room was small (which was to be expected in an old town building) and very clean. As I had asked for a quiet room we had no view other than the inside of the building's inner court, but then we didnt spent much time in the room anyway and it was quiet at night/morning. The staff was very friendly and it defenitely had a personal touch. You get a key to the front door, as there is no night auditor on duty. Never tried the breakfast (too jet lagged) but there is a delicious bakery in the neighbour hood which serves fresh baguettes, etc. Would defenitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best in its class for cleanliness and comfort”
Reviews.Author: jlb3
Reviews.Content: A great choice for a no-frills but quaint, clean and lovely little spot on a quiet street in the tenth. Rooms are as expected size-wise - not very large - but they are nicely appointed with comfortable beds, clean bathrooms and linens, and televisions. The proprietor is a kind and welcoming fellow and obviously puts a lot of care and attention into the look and feel of the place. The only thing I would have liked to have was A/C, but I realize that at this price point' in Paris, that would be non-standard. Luckily the street is pretty quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: P_Arrow
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel and amazing value. Stayed just one night but I can't find a thing to complain about. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, charming hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: dbandt
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this place. comfy bed, hip style, petit dejuner - (the proprietors make the confitures homemade!) totally reasonable price, perfect walking area, great shopping, metro stop a few feet away, grocery store 2 doors down, pub across the way, patisserie on the corner, salvation army across the street - could go on and on! Oh, and they have bikes!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with great service and free bikes!”
Reviews.Author: Skikate
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel as soon as I saw it. It's on a quiet street a couple of minutes from the metro and with a very pretty green leafy exterior. Rooms are small (as all are in Paris) but clean; service very friendly and helpful; and we were particularly pleased with the free bikes they offered - we ended up cycling around both our days in Paris, and as a result, ended up seeing far more than if we'd taken the metro. It's situated about 10 mins walk from the canal St Martin, which has a good selection of restaurants and bars, so is a good place to spend an evening. We decided not to take up the breakfast option, as there was a nice boulangerie just on the corner where we have croissants in the morning. A great base for exploring the delights of Paris!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: audis
Reviews.Content: Hotel du Nord was a positive surprise. Cleen and good rooms in a quiet street close to the metro. I will stay there on my next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: holly_gl
Reviews.Content: Great find in Paris. We stayed here as we wanted somewhere convenient to Gare du Nord for an overnight stay, but would definitely stay here again if staying longer in Paris. Very convenient, only 3 metro stops from Opera (which is itself v close to the big department stores). Hotel had a rustic feel, rooms small but comfy. No air con but there was a fan in the room. V helpful person on reception. Didn't have breakfast here (due to early train departure) so can't comment on it.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Parisen budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: fiona.swann
Reviews.Content: We travel regularly to Paris for pleasure, and always use this hotel as it is excellent value and very reliable. It has real character with antique's, books and photographs in the communal areas. The rooms can be small and basic (like most Paris hotels!), but always very clean and comfortable. The area around the Canal St Martin is also very interesting, as it is a real Paris neighbourhood. You are still close to the big sites by metro or even walking, as Paris is geographically quite small. The bikes are also a nice addition and a great way to get around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: clurejones
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris over New Year and wanted somewhere to stay which was indiviudal in style with charm rather than staying in a chain hotel. This was perfect. The price was very reasonable which allowed us to stay for 4 nights rather than just 2 or 3 if we had to pay more. The hotel itself is full of french antique furniture and mementos of parisian life, the rooms small but spotlessly clean. The hotel is right next to 2 Metro stations so we found it the perfect base to get around all the sights of Paris. It was very cold went we went but the rooms were warm and the bed very comfortable. All in all a great find and would recommend it for a perfect stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous little hideaway...”
Reviews.Author: BluestockingGirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem. It's quirky, with interesting furnishings and a down-to-earth feel. It's not plush, but on the other hand is very reasonably priced. The location is excellent and they let you borrow their bikes. The best thing is the breakfast, with delicious bread and homemade jam. Definitely recommended for people who like something individual in their hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ABergli
Reviews.Content: I wanted to feel that I was in Paris and not any other town so I wanted a hotel with "a feeling" - a soul. And I was not disappointed.. The hotel was just what I had in mind.. But that also means that it wasn't perfect in every detail... One could ask for more hangers - both for clothes and in the bathroom for towels, a better view from the window, better soundproof doors (we only heard the neighbours when arriving or leaving the room, not otherwise) and of course - an international breakfast. The breakfast now wasn't much for a skandinavian who thinks the breakfast is the most important meal of the day. :o) But the staff/owner(?) was friendly and serviceminded and the place was kept cleen at all times. The beds where excellent (we slept like babies every night) and we enjoyed the interior of the hotel and the room was big enough. The bathroom was fresh and clean with a bathtub. The breakfast was served in cosy basement. We really appreciated the possibility to borrow bikes from the hotel and we enjoyed Paris from the Saddle, although one could wish for working lights and bells. They did however lent us some reflexwests The street where the hotel is, is quiet and it is close to "Republic" - there is signposts almost everywhere in Paris, to Republic - and to canal St Martin which is the said to be the new Montmartre - so it was perfect. All in all we were satisfied.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel du Nord
HotelInfo.Address: 47, rue Albert Thomas, 75010 Paris, France
